comments.body:
The following additions would enable TBB for SPQR:

export SPQR_CONFIG="${SPQR_CONFIG} -DHAVE_TBB"
export TBB="-ltbb"_

If desired to enable OpenMP (used by CHOLMOD?), it looks like the addition would be:
export CFLAGS="$CFLAGS -fopenmp"

I really want to stay away from OpenMP for SuiteSparse. So many things are use to SuiteSparse's static linking and it is unclear to me what strategy SuiteSparse takes with statically linking to other libraries.

We know that statically linking to GOMP ends up being a horrible plan with breakage written all over. See this `gcc` [bug report](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=39176#c2) for details on why this is a bad idea. So, I'm eager to stay away from GOMP here because of this problem. Note GOMP is how we support OpenMP on Mac and Linux.

Though enabling TBB sounds fine and we have that at conda-forge already. I suppose we should also package METIS, but I'm not sure if it is worth the effort as it is packaged with SuiteSparse in 4.5.3.
Added TBB support in the next commit.

Also, according to the README, the METIS that is included in 4.5.3 has been patched so that it is compatible with Suitesparse's Matlab wrappers.  They do still support linking to an external METIS, instead, if desired ,though.  they just state that the wrappers cannot be used in that case
